accessibility_text:
###  ACCESSIBILITY

The Heckscher Museum is dedicated to creating an accessible and welcoming environment for all. In 2020, HMA adopted a suggested admission policy to eradicate cost barriers. Currently, free admission for the community is made possible through a generous grant from Bank of America. In 2022, the Museum began efforts to become fully bilingual in Spanish and English to accommodate the area’s growing Hispanic population. QR codes in the galleries provide multi-language wall text translation to hundreds of languages. Year-round public programming and collaborative efforts connect ongoing organization-wide work to advance diversity, equity, accessibility, accountability, and inclusion throughout the Museum.

Spanish translation and ASL is made possible by the New York State Council on the Arts with the support of the Office of the Governor and the New York State Legislature.

  * A wheelchair is available upon request for exploring the galleries.
  * Service animals are permitted in all galleries.
  * Parking for individuals with disabilities is available in the lot adjacent to the Museum.
  * There is an accessible restroom for individuals with disabilities in the Museum.
  * Large print versions of all Museum wall labels are available. Visitors are invited to borrow a booklet from a self-serve kiosk and take it with them as they explore the exhibitions.
